import React, {useState} from 'react' import Search from '../../components/Search' import Header from '../../components/Header' import MovieCard from '../../components/Movies/MovieCard' import Icon from '../../components/Icon' import '../../components/Search/Search.css' import Logo from '../../components/TMDB-Image' import Movie_API from '../../api/Movie_API' let response; const genre = { "Action": 28, 'Adventure': 12, "Animation" : 16, "Comedy": 35, "Crime": 80, "Documentary": 99, "Drama": 18, "Family" : 10751, "Fantasy": 14, "History": 36, "Horror": 27, "Music": 10402, "Mystery": 9648, "Romance": 10749, "Science Fiction": 878, "TV Movie": 10770, "Thriller": 53, "War": 10752, "Western": 37 } console.log(genre) const submitButton = async (event) => { const KEY = process.env.REACT_APP_API response = await Movie_API.get('/discover/movie', { params:{ api_key: KEY, language: 'en-US', include_adult: 'false', page: '1', with_genres: `${event.target.id}%2C%20` } }) console.log(response) } const Filter = () => { const [checked, setChecked] = useState(false) const handleClick = () =>{ setChecked(!checked) } return(
Search using these filters ⬇️
{Object.keys(genre).map(function(k) { return(
) })}
) } export default Filter
